I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

X: Type
c: (nat -> nat) -> nat -> X -> list Y
lc: X -> nat
Hc: forall (f : nat -> nat) (n : nat) (x : X), length (c f n x) = lc x
P: (nat * list X)%type
err: nat
i: nat

Goal:
linker (code_start P) = i

Premises:

link = fix link (i : nat) (ll : list X) (j : nat) {struct ll} : list (nat * nat) := match ll with | nil => nil | x :: ll0 => (i, j) :: link (S i) ll0 (lc x + j) end : nat -> list X -> nat -> list (nat * nat) Arguments link _%nat_scope _%list_scope _%nat_scope
comp = fun lnk : nat -> nat => fix comp (i : nat) (ll : list X) (j : nat) {struct ll} : list Y := match ll with | nil => nil | x :: ll0 => c lnk i x ++ comp (S i) ll0 (lc x + j) end : (nat -> nat) -> nat -> list X -> nat -> list Y Arguments comp _%function_scope _%nat_scope _%list_scope _%nat_scope
subcode_start_in_code : forall (X : Type) (P : code X) (Q : nat * list X), 0 < code_length P -> P <sc Q -> in_code (code_start P) Q
list_repeat : forall X : Type, X -> nat -> list X
existsb_nth : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l : list A) (n : nat) (d : A), n < length l -> existsb f l = false -> f (nth n l d) = false
compiler_subcode : forall (j : nat) (x : X), (j, x :: nil) <sc P -> (linker j, c linker j x) <sc (i, compiler) /\ linker (1 + j) = lc x + linker j
code = fun X : Type => (nat * list X)%type : Type -> Type Arguments code _%type_scope
comp_length : forall (lnk : nat -> nat) (i : nat) (ll : list X) (j : nat), length (comp lnk i ll j) = lsum ll
list_assoc : forall X Y : Type, eqdec X -> X -> list (X * Y) -> option Y
linker_app : forall ll mm : list X, snd P = ll ++ mm -> linker (length ll + fst P) = lsum ll + i
subcode_snoc_inv : forall (X : Type) (Q : code X) (i j : nat) (a l : list X), j = i + length l -> (i, l ++ a) <sc Q -> (j, a) <sc Q
subcode_length' : forall (X : Type) (P : code X) (Q : nat * list X), P <sc Q -> length (snd P) <= length (snd Q)
in_map : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (x : A), In x l -> In (f x) (map f l)
code_length : forall X : Type, code X -> nat
nth_error_In : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (n : nat) (x : A), nth_error l n = Some x -> In x l
firstn_all2 : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (l : list A), length l <= n -> firstn n l = l
skipn_all2 : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (l : list A), length l <= n -> skipn n l = nil
subcode_app_inv : forall (X : Type) (Q : code X) (i j : nat) (a l r : list X), j = i + length l -> (i, l ++ a ++ r) <sc Q -> (j, a) <sc Q
subcode_right : forall (X : Type) (n m : nat) (l r : list X), n = m + length l -> (n, r) <sc (m, l ++ r)
list_an = fix list_an (a n : nat) {struct n} : list nat := match n with | 0 => nil | S n0 => a :: list_an (S a) n0 end : nat -> nat -> list nat Arguments list_an (_ _)%nat_scope
Permutation.Permutation_nth : forall (A : Type) (l l' : list A) (d : A), l ~p l' < -> (let n := length l in length l' = n /\ (exists f : nat -> nat, FinFun.bFun n f /\ FinFun.bInjective n f /\ (forall x : nat, x < n -> nth x l' d = nth (f x) l d)))
partition_cons1 : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (a : A) (l l1 l2 : list A), partition f l = (l1, l2) -> f a = true -> partition f (a :: l) = (a :: l1, l2)

rewrite <- (Hc linker (length (snd P)) i). 
unfold linker. 
rewrite list_assoc_equiv. 
simpl. 
rewrite Nat.eq_dec_refl. 
reflexivity.
